sentence.Network_en: She sprinkled pepper on my grub, watching me nosh.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在我的食物上撒了点胡椒粉，看着我吃。

sentence.Network_en: Their ambitions are to bash out good grub with minimal fuss.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的目标就是尽可能省劲地大量供应可口饭菜。

sentence.Network_en: "But it's good grub," he added. "You're right," Pantieri assented.
sentence.Network_cn: “但是伙食不错，”他补充道。“没错，”潘蒂埃里表示同意。

澳大利亚——巫蛴螬（Witchetty grub）　　把巫蛴螬当成点心吃，这听起来有点吓人。澳大利亚人把某些飞蛾又大又白的幼虫称作巫蛴 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: perhaps related to Dutch grobbelen, also to grave

entry.def: A grub is a young insect which has just come out of an egg and looks like a short fat worm.

example.ex: Get yourself some grub and come and sit down.
example.tran: 你自己去盛些吃的，过来坐下吃。

entry.def: If you grub around, you search for something.

example.ex: I simply cannot face grubbing through all this paper.
example.tran: 我简直受不了要翻阅这么多文件。

means.word_mean: 2. a soft thick wormlike larva of certain beetles and other insects
1. ask for and get free; be a parasite

example.en: He got a fair grub-pile for a couple of dollars.
example.zh: 他花了几美元吃了一顿好饭。

sentences.en: Each of these eggs hatches out into a tiny grub.
sentences.cn: 这些虫卵中的每一个都将孵化出一条小幼虫。

means.word_mean: 挖土, 掘土;挖掘寻找
(急切地但通常为不得法地)寻找(尤指资料)

sentences.en: He found what he wanted by grubbing around in the library.
sentences.cn: 他在图书馆乱翻一通终于找到了需要的资料。

means.word_mean: 掘出， 挖出( 某物)

sentences.en: Thousands of miles of hedgerows have been grubbed up.
sentences.cn: 几千英里的树篱被挖了出来。

sentences.en: Where did the leader grub up that nasty bunch of soldier?
sentences.cn: 这个领导人从哪里搜罗到这群讨厌的士兵？
